Publishing and Printing         For your publishing and printing needs, resources including Copy Central and the Office of Advertising & Publications offer services to help you design, professionally finish, reprint and even digitally publish your projects. On-staff experts and designers and the latest publishing and printing technologies are available to university employees and students. To find about NYU’s creative, copy and media services, contact Copy Central or the Office of Advertising & Publications or visit their websites.               Copies   Copying and duplicating should be simple, accessible and affordable. That’s why Copy Central offers quick copy services and color laser copying, servicing your last-minute rush jobs as well as your more sophisticated color designs. Copy Central’s simple chargeback to your departmental budget minimizes administrative paper work, and avoids the administrative costs associated with paying commercial suppliers. For information on printing course packs, copyright compliance, copying services and pricing, contact Copy Central .       For copying convenience at locations across the NYU campus, several university buildings have their own copy centers that can be accessed by NYU employees and students. Bobst Library, the Stern School of Business and the Polytechnic Institute of NYU have their own copy centers, as do many university departments. For information on their copying services and payment methods, visit their websites.             Media   Copy Central’s services go beyond printing on paper. It also offers digital publishing services. Its DocuTech™ digital publishing systems capture text, line art, and photographs by scanning and converting them to digital masters. Contact Copy Central for more information its digital publishing capabilities.     Do you need assistance with your digital publishing projects? Copy Central provides print job preparation and output services, including electronic file translation and digital printing from your electronic illustration and layout files.           Creative Services (Design, etc.)   From business reports to brochures, the Office of Advertising & Publications and the NYU Design Group at Copy Central offer a full range of creative design services. Copy Central’s graphic design capabilities include print communications (brochures, manuals, reports), information design (charts, graphs, schedules) and promotional design (posters, signs, direct mail). Contact Copy Central for estimates and more information about its graphic design services. Contact the Office of Advertising & Publications for information about its graphic design services for both print and online communications.      Whether it’s print buying, bindery or finishing, Copy Central and the Office of Advertising & Publishing are equipped to make sure your printing is done affordably with high quality professional finish. For your print buying needs, Copy Central will take care of bidding and place your printing project with the right commercial source. Copy Central also offers a full range of bindery and finishing services, from collating to folding to lamination. For more information about its print buying, bindery and finishing services, visit the Copy Central website .       The Office of Advertising & Publishing’s services include publishing production and print procurement. Contact its office or visit its website for more information.     Members of the NYU community can use Copy Central to print university stationery and business cards. Employees must use the standard, university-wide template when getting stationery or business cards printed, available at Copy Central. Contact Copy Central or visit its website for information about ordering your business cards or stationery.     Is your projected printed and finished? Copy Central and the Office of Advertising & Publications offer fulfillment services including addressing, mailing and delivery. Whether it’s internal or external mailing, Copy Central will fold, insert and address your printed materials for delivery. The Office of Advertising & Publication includes mailing as part of its communication and printing services. For pricing and more information about their fulfillment services, contact Copy Central or the Office of Advertising & Publications .     For custom projects and premiums , contact the Office of Advertising & Publication or Copy Central.                                    Copy Central For services ranging from copying to design to addressing and mailing, Copy Central is a valuable publishing and printing resource.               Copy Central Services      Graphic Design & Typesetting    Copying & Duplicating    Digital Preparation & Output    Digital Publishing                       Advertising & Publications The Office of A & P is equipped to help with creative services, copying, printing and more. M.S. in Publishing: Digital and Print Media                                                                                          The NYU School of Professional Studies Website    Faculty    Degrees    Professional Certificates    Upcoming Events        Search Courses     Credit Course     Non-Credit Course          Site    Noncredit Courses    Faculty                                                                       Center for Publishing                                                                                           About             Director's Message Faculty Advisory Board News Watch Videos                   Admissions                 Academics             Graduate Offerings Noncredit Offerings Summer Publishing Institute Advanced Digital Publishing Institute                   Career                 Events             NYU Media Talk                   Initiatives             Publisher's Training Program                   Alumni                                                   M.S. in Publishing: Digital and Print Media                                          Academics ›                Graduate Offerings                 Curriculum          Opportunities and Outcomes          Faculty          Admissions Process          Advisory Board                   Noncredit Offerings            Summer Publishing Institute            Advanced Digital Publishing Institute            Watch Videos                             Ready to Proceed?           Apply Now        Request Information        Events                                                                                     M.S. in Publishing: Digital and Print Media          feature subtitle 1          feature text                             The M.S. in Publishing: Digital and Print Media , offered through the NYU School of Professional Studies Center for Publishing, provides you with a solid foundation in book and magazine publishing, with a major focus on digital media. The program develops the core competencies of content creation and editing, while also emphasizing the business, digital media, and marketing skills that are necessary to secure leadership roles in the industry.   With a goal of exposing you to "real-world, real-workplace" scenarios, the curriculum reflects the most current industry trends, including best practices in e-books, apps, and mobile platforms and video. Your studies begin with core courses that provide a comprehensive framework in the essential elements of the publishing process. Media specialization courses delve into the most critical business aspects of the industry and provide the expertise needed to master them.       The core course requirements are designed to provide you with an in-depth understanding of the most important elements of publishing. While completing the core courses, you also take courses from three media specializations: media content development, media marketing and distribution, and media profitability. Advanced seminars provide a thorough exploration of key industry topics. You complete the program with a capstone project that allows you to draw on the skills you’ve acquired.   While rigorous coursework is key to your success in the program, you also will be provided with numerous opportunities to expand your publishing knowledge outside of the classroom. In addition to industry events and visits, the M.S. in Publishing: Digital and Print Media has developed a strong global program. As the publishing industry becomes not only more digital, but global, an understanding of international publishing practices is imperative. Students are invited to apply for trips to international book fairs and conferences, where they can volunteer their time in return for the opportunity to participate in global events and discussions. In recent years, students have served as marketing, publicity, and educational programming volunteers at the Frankfurt, London, Abu Dhabi, and Sharjah (UAE) international book fairs and at the FIPP International Magazine conference in Rome. These opportunities are underwritten by department grants for a select number of students.           Program Location : NYU Midtown Center                 From the Director                                                       Andrea Chambers        "Our goal is to prepare today’s professional for success and career satisfaction."          Read More                      Specializations           Media Content Development         Media Marketing and Distribution         Media Profitability                 View General Curriculum            Learn More            NYU School of Professional Studies faculty and staff members look forward to learning more about you, and we want you to learn more about us, to ensure that your decisions regarding your educational experience are well informed. Our admissions staff is here to partner with you throughout the admissions process. Please do not hesitate to contact us .                   Ready to Proceed? Magazines and Newspapers - Wallerstein Collaborative - NYU Steinhardt                                               Skip to content      NYU Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development         Contact                                     Wallerstein Collaborative For Urban Environmental Education            Department of Teaching and Learning           Magazines and Newspapers                              Audubon    Alternatives: Canadian Environmental Ideas and Action    BioScience: American Institute of Biological Sciences    E- Environm ental  Magazine    E/The Environmental Magazine is a bimonthly “clearinghouse” of information, news and resources for people concerned about the environment who want to know “What can I do?” to make a difference. A 13-time Independent Press Awards winner and nominee, E is chock full of everything environmental -- from recycling to rainforests, and from the global village to our own backyards.    Environmental Education and Advocacy    Cambridge University Press publishes the finest academic and educational writing from around the world and is dedicated to advancing knowledge, education, learning and research. Since publishing its first work in 1584, Cambridge now publishes over 2500 titles and 200 journals every year.    Earth (Formally known as Geotimes)    Earth Island Journal    Earth Island Journal has long been recognized as a cutting edge source of news, analysis and commentary on the vital environmental issues of our day. Published quarterly since 1987, the Journal has won significant acclaim for its groundbreaking and award-winning coverage.    Environment News Service    Go to the Environment News Service website for the latest environmentalnews, current issues, climate, water, food, forests, species, energy and education.    Environmental News Network - Online Newspaper    The Environmental News Network (ENN) is the largest, most recognized online environmental news source in the world. Since 1993, ENN has provided balanced and non-partisan news, information, and interactive resources for individuals, organizations, and corporations with environmental interests.    Discover Magazine    Green Teacher: Education for Planet Earth    Grist Magazine    Grist is an environmental news and commentary magazine. The articles cover national and international environmental issues and provide website and email news services for free.    Mother Earth News  Mother Jones  National Geographic    National Science Teachers Association WebNews    The National Science Teachers Association (NSTA), founded in 1944 and headquartered in Arlington, Virginia, is the largest organization in the world committed to promoting excellence and innovation in science teaching and learning for all. NSTA's current membership of more than 55,000 includes science teachers, science supervisors, administrators, scientists, business and industry representatives, and others involved in and committed to science education. Their website has up to date science and education news from around the country.    National Wildlife    Natural Awakenings    Natural History    New Scientist    New Scientist    New York State Conservationist - Magazine    The New York State Conservationist is an award winning advertisement free magazine focusing on New York State's great outdoors and resources featuring stunning photography, informative articles, and around the state coverage. Want to know more about destinations for outdoor family fun? Are you interested in learning about wildlife? Conservationist has it covered---from camping to fishing, skiing and boating...and much, much more.    Ranger Rick    Science News    Scientific American Explorations - Magazine    Scientific American, the oldest continuously published magazine in the U.S., has been bringing its readers unique insights about developments in science and technology for more than 150 years.    Sierra    VegNews    Waterwire - Online News Service    The Metropolitan Waterfront Alliance works through education, grassroots organizing and media advocacy to include the public's voice and values in the decision making that will determine the future of our region's waterfront and waterways. Their waterwire news includes information on waterfronts, water quality and environmental issues throughout the tri-state area.
